( BlockComment ) (single line as well as multiline) ( before -- after ) stack comment convention
%{BlockComment (nestable)%}Note: Both percent–bracket symbols must be the only non-whitespace characters on their respective lines.

Language: Pascal, Modula-2, Modula-3, Oberon, and ML:

Block comment: =beginBlockComment=cut (=end in Ruby) (POD documentation comment) __END__Comments after end of code
''' BlockComment '''""" BlockComment """ (Documentation string when first line of module, class, method, or function)
#`{BlockComment} =comment This comment paragraph goes until the next POD directive or the first blank line.[19][20]
